meaning: To identify the control that activates the moderate intensity, forward illumination. To indicate the operational status of the low beam function.
To identify the control that activates the moderate intensity, forward illumination. To indicate the operational status of the low beam function.

To identify the control that operates the visual indicators to signal the intended turning direction (left or right) of the machine or road vehicle. To indicate the operational status of the turn signal and the selected turning direction.
To Identify the control that activates all side markers and tail lights in a predetermined flashing pattern. To indicate the operational status of the hazard warning.
To Identify the control which activates the front wipers and initiates a sweeping motion to clear the windscreen/windshield.
To Identify the control which activates the front wipers and dispenses washing fluid, initiating a sweeping motion and fluid spray to clear the windscreen/windshield.
To identify the control which dispenses washing fluid to the windscreen/windshield.
To identify the control which activates the fan and circulates air at a speed selected by the user. To indicate the operational status of the fan function.
To identify the control for activating the rear wipers which use a sweeping motion to clear the rear window.
To identify the control which activates the rear wipers and dispenses washing fluid, initiating a sweeping motion and fluid spray to clear the rear window.
To identify the control which dispenses washing fluid to the rear window.
To identify the control which allows up or down adjustment to the forward facing high (main) or low (dipped) beam.
To indicate low unleaded fuel. To identify the unleaded fuel gauge. To identify the unleaded fuel filler cap or fill point.
To indicate that the park brake has failed or is malfunctioning or is not operating within the specified range of parameters.
To indicate that the primary braking function has malfunctioned.
To identify the control that activates low intensity illumination (typically located on the sides of the vehicle). To indicate the operational status of the parking lights.

To identify the control that opens the compartment located outside the passenger area in the front of the vehicle (typically to access to vehicle engine). To indicate that the bonnet (hood) is open or not latched properly.

To identify the control that opens the compartment located outside the passenger area in the rear of the vehicle (typically to access to storage). To indicate that the boot (trunk) is open or not latched properly.
To identify the control for the choke (low temperature starting aid), which adjusts the fuel-to-air ratio in the combustion chamber. To indicate the operational status of the choke.
To identify the control for the horn which emits a sound, usually intended to alert persons in the vicinity to the presence of the equipment or vehicle.
To indicate low fuel. To identify the fuel gauge. To identify the fuel filler cap or fill point. May also be used instead of ISO 7000-1551 to indicate fuel level.
To indicate that the engine coolant may be overheating or fails outside of specified parameters. To identify the engine coolant temperature gauge.

To indicate whether the battery is charging. To identify the display that provides information about the battery charging condition. To indicate that the battery charging condition falls outside specified parameters.
To indicate that the engine oil is low or fails outside of specified parameters. To identify the engine oil gauge. To identify the engine oil filler cap or fill point.
To indicate the status of a three-point seat belt (belt with single shoulder harness).

To identify the control that activities the wipers located near the high (main)/low (dipped) beams and dispenses washing fluid, initiating a sweeping motion and fluid spray to clear the high (main)/low (dipped) beams. To identify the headlamp cleaner filler cap or fill point.

To indicate that caution is necessary when operating the device or control close to where the symbol is placed. To indicate that the current situation needs operator awareness or operator action in order to avoid undesirable consequences. On the health app quality label: to indicate that the health app requires approval from a health professional for use.

To identify the control that activates low intensity illumination (typically located on the sides, front and rear of the vehicle). To indicate the operational status of the position lights or side lights.
To identify the control that activates the engine heating element to assist in starting the engine at low temperatures. To indicate the operational status of the engine heating element.
To identify the control that warms a cylinder tip to a temperature sufficient to cause combustion. To identify thelocation of the lighter.

To identify the control that activates a special light (usually yellow in colour) located in the front of the vehicle to aid forward illumination in foggy conditions. To indicate the operational status of the front fog light.

To identify the control that activates a special light (usually yellow in colour) located in the rear of the vehicle to aid with vehicle identification in foggy conditions. To indicate the operational status of the rear fog light.
To identify the control that distributes air flow to the front and side windows to aid in removing frost, fog and mist. To indicate the operational status of windscreen demisting and defrosting.
To identify the control that distributes air flow to the front and side windows to aid in removing frost, fog and mist. To indicate the operational status of windscreen demisting and defrosting.

To identify the control that distributes air flow or a low electrical current to the rear window to aid in removing frost, fog and mist. To indicate the operational status of rear windscreen demisting and defrosting.

To identify the control that distributes air flow or a low electrical current to the rear window to aid in removing frost, fog and mist. To indicate the operational status of rear windscreen demisting and defrosting.
To indicate the control that locks each door prohibiting ingress and egress. To indicate the operational status of the door lock.
To indicate a possible malfunction of the engine or emission system.
To identify the control that intermittently, at specified time intervals, operates the wiper that clears water from the windscreen (front window).
To identify the control that raises or lowers the side (lateral) window using a powered mechanism.
To identify the control for the device that warms the seat cushion and seatback. To indicate the operational status of the heated seat.
To identify the control for the device that warms the seat cushion and seatback. To indicate the operational status of the heated seat.
To identify oil or other non-water base fluid. On an indicator to identify oil or used to identify a fill cap.
To identify the control for operation of the rotating and/or blinking light attached to equipment. To indicate the operational status of the identification or beacon light.
To identify the control for operation of the working light attached to a mast. To indicate the operational status of the working light.
To identify the type of engine, especially a reciprocating internal combustion engine.
To identify the general transmission symbol, to be used in conjunction with other symbols.
To identify the general transmission symbol, to be used in conjunction with other symbols.
To identify the control that activates the work light. To indicate the operational status of the work light.
To indicate that the engine has failed or is malfunctioning or is not operating within the specified range of parameters.
To indicate that the fuel system has failed or is malfunctioning.
To identify the display that provides information about fuel temperature. To indicate fuel temperature.
To identify the control that disengages the flow of fuel to the engine. To indicate that fuel flow to the engine has been interrupted. Use only for fuel shut-off control.
To identify the control that disengages the flow of fuel to the engine. To indicate that fuel flow to the engine has been interrupted. Use only for fuel shut-off control.
To indicate that the transmission has failed or is malfunctioning.
To indicate that the transmission has failed or is malfunctioning.
To identify the display that provides information about the brake system.
To indicate that the anti-lock brake system has failed.
To indicate that the brake linings are worn, which may cause a malfunction of the brake system.
To identify the control that operates the interior compartment illumination. To indicate the operational status of the dome light.
To identify the control that operates the interior compartment illumination. To indicate the operational status of the dome light.
To indicate that tyre pressure is outside of normal operating parameters.
To indicate that tyre pressure is outside of normal operating parameters.
To identify the locking control. To indicate that a control is locked. To indicate that the function cannot be changed or adjusted because its operation is locked. To identify the location of a lock.
To indicate the status of a two-point seatbelt (belt with no shoulder harness).

To identify a control that operates by movement of a lever or other device in multiple directions, with each direction effecting a different function. To identify the directions in which the control moves.
To identify the control for the seat. To indicate the operational status of the seat.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from both the defrost and lower air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from both the defrost and lower air outlets.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from both the defrost and lower air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from both the defrost and lower air outlets.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from the upper air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from the upper air outlets.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from the lower air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from the lower air outlets.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from the lower air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from the lower air outlets.

To identify the control for the cruise control system, which automatically accelerates or decelerates the vehicle to maintain a pre-set speed. To indicate the operational status of the cruise control system.

To identify the control for the traction control system, which controls longitudinal wheel slip of the drive wheels through changes in engine torque or braking. To indicate the operational status of the traction control system.
To identify the control for the airbag system, which deploys an inflated bag designed to lessen injury to vehicle occupants in a collision. To indicate the operational status of the airbag system.
To indicate information about the tyre.
To identify the control that cancels or switches off the rearward moving alarm.
To identify the control for the radar sensor. To indicate that data used to determine machine ground speed have been obtained using radar.
To indicate that the operational status of the reversing (back-up) lights.
To identify the control for the steering system. To indicate the operational status of the steering system.
To indicate that maintenance to the engine is needed.

To identify the control that activates or deactivates a light source located near or at the vehicle roofline, illuminating the rear of the vehicle. To indicate the operational status of the loading light.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates a light source located in the front of the vehicle above normal headlamp height. To indicate the operational status of the elevated headlights.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates a sign located on the roof of the vehicle. To indicate the operational status of the roof sign.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates an interior low level operator controlled light source focusing light on a defined area.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates a sign reading TAXI located on the roof of the vehicle. To indicate the operational status of the TAXI light.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates a sign displaying a medical cross located on the roof of the vehicle. To indicate the operational status of the medical assistance light.
To identify the control that activates the retarder as a supplemental to brake system.

To identify the control that aids in filtering pollutants and odours from fresh and recirculated air within the vehicle interior. To indicate the air filter is outside normal operating parameters, for example dirty. To identify the location of the passenger compartment air filter.
To identify the control that activates the adaptive cruise control system. To indicate the operational status of the adaptive cruise control system.
To indicate that the adaptive cruise control system has failed or is operating outside of normal parameters.
To identify the control that activates a system to detect object(s) near the vehicle when parking. To indicate the operational status of the parking aid.
To identify the location of the cupholder.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates a lower intensity low beam headlights, for better visibility. To indicate the operational status of the lights.

On passenger vehicles: to identify a feature using engine friction and compression with transmission control and a closed throttle. The parameters are such that ""descent control"" will function on downhill grade when throttle is zero, transmission output speed is increasing at a predetermined rate, and the operators' foot is on the brake.

On passenger vehicles: to identify an OFF or NOT AVAILABLE state for the stability control system. Stability system is designed to improve vehicle-handling characteristics on unfavorable road conditions in order to minimize skidding and spinning.
Identifies the control that operates the infrared or similar technology that displays a forward roadway scene beyond the typical headlight beam. As a telltale: indicates operational status.
Identifies the control that operates the lighting that illuminates the floor area only, separate from overhead compartment lighting. As a telltale: indicates operational status.

Identifies the control that operates interior compartment lighting (typically a red lens) used to assist in maintaining the dark adaptation of the driver while providing illumination to the interior. As a telltale: indicates operational status.
Identifies the control that operates the illumination of only the sleeping area, separate from overhead compartment lighting. As a telltale: indicates operational status.
Identifies the control that operates the fan or ventilation system specific to the sleeping area. As a telltale: indicates operational status.

Identifies the control on passenger cars that operates the forward collision warning system, which alerts the driver to imminent forward collision. As a telltale: indicates operational status or alert.

Identifies the control on passenger cars that operates the lane departure warning system, which alerts the driver when his vehicle is leaving the identified driving lane. As a telltale: indicates operational status or alert.

On road vehicles: to identify the tell-tale or display that alerts the driver to obstacle proximity in their vehicle's blind spot as a warning for changing lanes or passing (overtaking) other vehicles; also activates if another vehicle drifts into the monitored area.
To identify the control which enables an increase in engine power beyond the normal maximum, or to indicate that the engine is operating beyond its normal maximum power.
To identify the control for the fan which pulls air through the radiator to cool the engine, or to indicate the operational status of the engine cooling fan.

To identify the control that operates the system that heats windshield wiper fluid to aid in cleaning the windshield in cold weather. On a telltale: to indicate the status (for example, on, off, malfunction).
To identify the control that allows the side airbags to be shut off or engaged. On a telltale: to indicate the operational status (for example, active, malfunction).

To identify the control that activates the front windscreen wiper electrical heating system for de-icing wiper and freeing the blade. On a telltale: to identify the status (for example, on, off, malfunction) of the function.
To identify the control that activates the mechanism that folds the headrest for rear view visibility. On a telltale: to indicate the status (for example, on, off, malfunction).
To identify the control that activates a warming device to heat the steering wheel. On a telltale: to indicate the status (for example, on, off, malfunction).

To indicate that the engine emissions system temperature is outside of normal operating parameters. To indicate the engine emissions system temperature. To indicate that active regeneration of the diesel particulate filter is underway and elevated emission system temperatures are possible; engine operation can be affected.

To indicate that the engine emissions system temperature is outside of normal operating parameters. To indicate the engine emissions system temperature. To indicate that active regeneration of the diesel particulate filter is underway and elevated emission system temperatures are possible; engine operation can be affected.
To identify the axle fluid temperature gauge. On a telltable: to indicate that axle fluid may be overheating or that the axle fluid temperature falls outside specified parameters.
To identify the control that allows passenger side airbags to be shut off or engaged. On a telltale: to indicate the operational status (for example, active, malfunction).
On a telltale: An orange light with this symbol indicates, when lit, the smart key is not found.
To identify the control used to activate the axle lock function. To indicate that the axle lock function is either activated (engaged/on) or is available.
To identify the control position for the high (fast) engine speed setting. To indicate that the engine is operating at the high (fast) engine speed setting.
To identify the control position for the low (slow) engine speed setting. To indicate that the engine is operating at the low (slow) engine speed setting.

To identify the control the indicator for the trailer position (clearance) lights in a tractor/trailer vehicle when separate controls are provided for the tractor and trailer position lights.Note:When there are separate controls, use ISO 7000-0456 for the tractor position lights and this symbol for the trailer position lights.

To identify the control or the indicator for the trailer interior lights in a tractor/trailer vehicle when separate controls are provided for the tractor and trailer interior lights.Note: When there are separate controls, use ISO 7000-2457 for the tractor interior (dome) lights and this symbol for the trailer interior lights. The indicator is intended to alert the driver that the trailer interior light has been left on.
To identify the control or the indicator for forward headlights that are separate from the normal vehicle headlights (which are blocked by the snow plough blade).

To identify the control for the automatic high beam function, which automatically switches the high beam on and off as necessary. To indicate the current activation mode or operational status of the system.Note: The letter A may be deleted and replaced by AUTO added below the symbol.

To identify the control for the automatic low beam function, which automatically switches the low beam on and off as necessary. To indicate the current activation mode or operational status of the system.Note: The letter A may be deleted and replaced by AUTO added below the symbol.

To identify the control or the indicator for the interior temperature of the trailer.Note: Refrigerated trailers or box van trailers can have internal temperature sensors that provide a warning to the tractor driver if the temperature goes outside some desired boundary. The warning indicator is normally on the vehicle dashboard.
To indicate that the transmission needs to be serviced.

To indicate that the child seat or vehicle is equipped with a child seat presence and orientation detection (CPOD) system, which automatically senses the presence and orientation of a child seat placed on a passenger seat, and disables or depowers airbag deployment for that passenger seat.

To identify the control label or the indicator for the system that monitors the area surrounding the vehicle to alert the driver about the presence of potential obstacles.Note: Obstacles are objects that could either impact into or be impacted by the driver's vehicle. Sensor waves may be removed or relocated to better represent the actual sensor detection zones.
To identify the control for the hood release in a conventional heavy truck. To indicate that the truck's hood is released or ajar.

To identify the control or the malfunction indicator for the system that displays information to the driver on the vehicle windshield.Note: Typically, the displayed information is low on the windshield with a focal distance near the front of the hood (bonnet).

To identify the control that when activated makes an emergency call (eCall) to a call centre for getting help in case of an accident or other emergency. To indicate that the emergency call is in progress, from call initiation to hang-up. To indicate the system status.
To identify the control or the malfunction indicator for the system that allows users to adjust the transparency of roof glazing from clear (transparent) to opaque.
To identify the control for the system that detects and alerts a drowsy driver. To indicate the operational status of the system (for example, active, inactive, malfunctioning).

To identify the control or indicator for the system that automatically or semi-automatically parks the vehicle. The system may only steer the vehicle, or it may both steer and brake the vehicle into the parking slot.

To indicate to the driver that a rest break should be considered. To identify the indicator for a system that monitors and assesses the risk of any erratic driving behaviour in order to alert the driver that a rest break should be considered.

On motorcycles and mopeds, to identify the control that actuates the electric starter function. To identify the control that electrically starts the engine.Note: Only ISO 7000-3033A shall be used on motorcycles and mopeds.
On motorcycles and mopeds, to identify the control that actuates the electric starter function. To identify the control that electrically starts the engine.

To identify the control that activates or deactivates the system for automatically starting and stopping the engine when the engine is in an idle state if specified preconditions are met. To indicate the operational status of the system (for example, active, inactive, malfunctioning).

To identify the control on passenger cars that operates a driver assistance system to keep a vehicle between lane markings. To indicate the operational status of the system (for example, active, inactive, malfunctioning).

To indicate that the temperature of the propulsion battery in an electric or hybrid electric vehicle falls outside of specified temperature parameters. To identify the propulsion battery temperature gauge.

To identify the control that activates or deactivates the system that generates a sound to indicate to road users that a quiet vehicle is operational in the vicinity. To indicate the operational status of the sound device.
To indicate that the passenger seat is equipped with CPOD (child seat presence and orientation detection) system.
To indicate that the engine cooling fan has failed, is malfunctioning or is operating outside the specified range of parameters.
To identify the control that effects an unlocking function. To indicate that the component or function is in its unlocked state.
To identify the control that lubricates engine components before the engine is started. To indicate that the engine is in the pre-start lubrication mode.
To indicate that the temperature of one or more engine system functions (for example: oil, coolant, intake air, exhaust gas) is outside normal operating parameters.
To identify the control that reverses the direction of rotation of the engine cooling fan. To indicate that the engine cooling fan is operating in the revise direction from normal.
To indicate the engine power output or the rated engine power.
To identify the control that sets the operating engine power as a per cent of rated engine power. To indicate the actual power output as a per cent of engine rated power.
To indicate that the engine performance is decreased (derated) by the engine controller because of operational parameters that are outside specified limits.
To identify the display that provides information about the temperature of the differential gear oil. To indicate the temperature of the differential gear oil.
To identify the auxiliary hydraulic cylinder.
To identify the first selective control valve on the machine. To identify the control for the first SCV.
To identify the control that drains fluid from the brake system. To indicate that fluid is draining from the brake system.
To identify the control that deactivates the parking brake.
To indicate that the park brake has failed or is malfunctioning or is not operating within the specified range of parameters.
To identify the display that provides information on fuel consumption per unit of area worked. To indicate fuel consumption rate as volume or mass per unit of area worked.
To identify the display that provides information on the area worked per unit of fuel consumed. To indicate the area worked per unit of fuel consumed.
To identify the fuel cooler. To indicate the operational status of the fuel cooler.
To identify the control for the wiper that clears moisture from the side (lateral) window.
To identify the horizontal type exterior rear view mirror.
To identify the automatic temperature control for heating and cooling systems. To indicate the operational status of the automatic temperature control system.
To identify functions related to the operator cabin. Use as a symbol element in the development of related symbols.
To indicate the ambient air temperature outside of the operator cabin.
To indicate the ambient air temperature inside of the operator cabin. To identify the control that adjusts the ambient temperature inside the operator cabin.
To identify the display that provides information about the pressure drop across the engine oil filter. To indicate the engine oil filter pressure.
To identify the control that drains oil from the engine. To indicate that oil is draining from the engine.
To identify the control that drains coolant from the engine cooling system. To indicate that coolant is draining from the engine cooling system.
To identify the display that provides information about the pressure drop across the engine intake (combustion) air filter. To indicate the engine intake (combustion) air filter pressure.
To identify the filter for the air that flows into the engine crankcase. To indicate the operational status of the crankcase air/ventilation filter.
To identify the switch or switch position for the automatic control of engine rotational speed. To indicate that engine rotational speed is in the automatic control mode.
To identify the control that establishes the first set speed for the engine. To indicate the engine first set speed.
To identify the control that establishes the second set speed for the engine. To indicate the engine second set speed.
To identify the control that increases or decreases the engine rotational speed by switching between two specified values.
To identify the control that increases the engine rotational speed.
To identify the control that automatically increases the engine rotational speed.
To identify the control that sets the maximum engine rotational speed. To indicate the maximum engine rotational speed.

To indicate that the control that decreases the engine rotational speed is switched off or is otherwise not available for use. To indicate that the engine speed is decoupled from the transmission speed so that a decrease in engine speed does not decrease transmission speed.
To identify the computer or microchip that collects data on the performance of engine, controls engine operations or adjusts engine operating conditions in response to inputs.
To identify the location of the port to which engine diagnostic equipment is connected. To indicate that the engine diagnostic port is in use.
To indicate that the transmission is functioning in manual operating mode whereby the transmission gear is selected by the operator and does not change until the operator selects a different gear.
To indicate that the transmission is functioning in automatic operating mode whereby the transmission gear is selected without intervention by the operator.
To identify the breather filter for the transmission. To identify the location of the transmission breather filter. To indicate the operational status of the transmission breather filter.
To identify the control that causes the transmission to increase its gear position by skipping the next available gear.
To identify the control that causes the transmission to decrease its gear position by skipping the next available gear.
To identify the control that locks the transmission. To indicate that the transmission is locked.
To identify the control that drains fuel from the fuel tank. To indicate that fuel is draining from the fuel tank.
To identify the control that drains diesel fuel from the diesel fuel tank. To indicate that diesel fuel is draining from the diesel fuel tank.
To indicate that the water content in the fuel has reached a specified concentration. To indicate the concentration of water in the fuel.
To identify the control that drains water from the fuel. To indicate that water is draining from the fuel.
To identify the display that provides information on fuel consumption per hour of operation. To indicate fuel consumption rate as volume or mass per hour of operation.
To identify the control that adjusts the instrument illumination to its nighttime level. To identify the control that adjusts the illumination of the display screen to its nighttime level.
To identify the control that allows air to flow from the upper, lower, and defrost air outlets. To indicate that air is flowing from the upper, lower, and defrost air outlets.
To identify the control that allows fresh air to enter the operator cabin from outside. To indicate the operational status of the outside air flow function.

To identify the control that prevents entrance of air from outside the operator cabin and allows the cabin air to recirculate. To indicate the operational status of the recirculating air flow function.
To identify the control for initiating an alcohol test of the driver. To indicate the operational status of the alcohol interlock device or that an alcohol test of the driver is required.
To identify the vehicle’s electric power supply port, for example for the propulsion battery.
To indicate that the tyre is categorized as extended mobility tyre according to ISO 16992
To indicate that the tyre is categorized as run flat tyre or self-supporting tyre according to ISO 16992
To identify the control that operates the tail lift. To indicate the operational status of the tail lift.
To identify the control that operates the rear step ladder. To indicate the operational status of the rear step ladder.
To identify a Type 1 commercial vehicle as seen from the side.
To identify a Type 2 commercial vehicle as seen from the side.
To indicate the engine load (torque) or the rated engine load
To identify the control for deploying or retracting the coupling ball into the position. To indicate deployed or retracted status of the coupling ball and malfunction of positioning mechanism
To indicate the maximum propeller output of a marine engine. To indicate on the builders plate of a small craft the maximum allowable power to be fitted to the craft.
To identify the control that activates or deactivates the brake assisted steering function. To indicate the operational status of the brake assisted steering function.
To identify the control that sets the operating engine load as a percentage of rated engine torque. To indicate the actual load on the engine as a percentage of engine rated torque.
To identify the control that sets or adjusts the sensitivity setting for the engine. To indicate the sensitivity setting for the engine.

To identify the control that, when activated, provides continuous automatic control of the transmission for optimal power management during field operations. To indicate that the operational status of the transmission management system is for field operation.

To identify the control that, when activated, provides continuous automatic control of the transmission for optimal power management during trailer towing operations. To indicate the operational status of the transmission management system is for trailer towing operation.

To identify the control that, when activated, provides continuous automatic control of the transmission for optimal power management during road operations. To indicate that the operational status of the transmission management system is for road operation.
To identify the control that activates the low sensitivity setting for the transmission. To indicate that the transmission sensitivity is set to low sensitivity.
To identify the control that activates the medium sensitivity setting for the transmission. To indicate that the transmission sensitivity is set to medium sensitivity.
To identify the control that activates the continuously variable sensitivity setting for the transmission. To indicate that the transmission is in the continuously variable mode for sensitivity.
To identify the control that activates the continuously variable setting for transmission operation. To indicate that the transmission is in CVT operation mode.

To identify the control that switches off or otherwise interrupts all power to the PTO. To indicate that the PTO is stopped and unable to restart until positive action is taken by the operator to enable PTO operation.
To identify the control that electrically heats the transmission to assist in starting at low temperatures. To indicate that the transmission preheat is activated.
To indicate the location of a safety belt lower anchorage attachment point (vehicle anchor) meeting ISOFIX or LATCH specifications for securing a child seat in a vehicle.
To identify the location of the safety belt upper anchorage attachment point for securing the child seat in the vehicle.
To indicate seat sensor failure or malfunction.
To indicate that the automatic idle start/stop function cannot be used.
To Indicate that electric propulsion is engaged and that forward and reverse motion is possible.
To identify an electric-powered motorcycle.
To identify the motorcycle from a profile (side) view.
To identify the location of the port to which diagnostic equipment is connected. To indicate that the diagnostic port is in use.

To identify the device or control that causes interruption of a power line from the battery to the starting motor. To indicate that the engine starting motor electric power line from the battery is interrupted.
To indicate that the driver is required to take control of the vehicle by putting or keeping their hands on the steering wheel or to indicate that steering is required.
